description: a(n+1) is smallest palindromic prime containing exactly 3 more digits on each end than the previous term, with a(n) as a central substring.
links: Giovanni Resta, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..26 (full sequence)
author: _G. L. Honaker, Jr._, Jan 28 2000
extensions: Shown to be finite by _Felice Russo_
